title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Improv 201: Scene Work & Short Form Games at the Training Center
description:
Improv 201: Scene Work and Short Form Games at the Push Comedy Theater

This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. Students will focus on scene work, specifically building believable characters, strong relationships, and establishing baseline reality.

Students will also train in a variety of short form improv games similar to the ones seen on Whose Line is it Anyway?.

All classes will be outdoors and will practice social distancing measures. Masks are required. Graduation shows are delayed until further notice.

This course will be offered outdoors at the Push Comedy Theater.  The class will meet Monday nights for 6 weeks.

The safety of our staff and students is our utmost concern.  This class caps at 10 students.  Masks are required and social distancing will be enforced as much as possible.

Cost: $200Push Comedy Theater763 Granby Street

Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 201 Wait List".

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Improv 301: Intro to Harold and Game at Push Comedy Theater
description:
Improv 301: Intro to Harold and Game at Push Comedy Theater



This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101 & 201. Students will learn the beginnings 'The Harold,' a long form improvisation structure developed by Del Close. They will learn how to identify the 'game' of a scene and how to heighten these games to develop 'second beats'.


This course will be offered outdoors at the Push Comedy Theater Training. The class will meet Tuesday nights for 6 weeks.
The safety of our staff and students is our utmost concern.This class caps at 10 students. Masks are required and social distancing will be enforced as much as possible.

Cost: $200Push Comedy Theater Training Center2710 Granby Street

Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 301 Wait List".

title: October Laughter Class Subscription (One Lecture FREE!!)
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.



Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Lectures are $10 individually OR sign up for our OCTOBER Laughter Class Subscription! Get access to all four lectures for the month of October for the low, looooow price of $30.



We did the math, that means ONE LECTURE IS FREE!!



This is a VIRTUAL event. Zoom links for each lecture will be emailed to you from Push Comedy Theater at least one hour before each show.



This month features:

October 7th - Alba Woolard, BFA; Pusher and Co-Creator of Panties in a Twist with “Directing for Sketch Comedy: clarifying the unknown”

October 14th - Whittney Millsap from Dad’s Garage and Sweater Puppies with “The Spirit of Unconditional Onstage Support”

October 21st - Sean Devereux, Pusher and Sketch Comedian with "The Nuts and Bolts of Running a Sketch Show"

October 28th - Scot Rose from Push Comedy Theater with “Applying The Rules of Improv to Your Daily Life”



Sign up today to fill your Wednesday's with wisdom and wise cracks!



Yes, and any questions? Email us at pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Laughter Class: Directing for Sketch Comedy with Alba Woolard
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.

Directing for Sketch Comedy: clarifying the unknown 
Directing can sometimes feel like a vague task, and for good reason. There is no one thing that a director has 100% responsibility for. Rather, the director is responsible for bringing all of the pieces together that make a great show, and for doing so in a cohesive way. The director supports turning good material into great material by bringing it to life. 
So how do you assess what makes a cohesive, and entertaining show?
This lecture will break down the many facets of a director's job into manageable chunks. You'll learn tips for working with new actors, collaborating with the production team, and guiding creative discoveries in bringing sketches from the page to the stage. 

Alba Woolard, BFA:
Alba Woolard joined The Pushers Sketch and Improv Comedy in 2009, where she performed and directed for more than 10 years. She is a founding member of the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk Virginia, and was the Director, Co-Creator and Co-Producer of Panties in a Twist: The All Female Sketch Comedy Show from 2012 to 2018. 
In Chicago, Alba has performed with local comedy groups, and was the Co-Director for "Uncuffing Season: A Valentines Day Sketch Comedy Show."
Alba holds a BFA in Acting from Old Dominion University and is a graduate of Second City's Musical Improv Conservatory program in Chicago, IL. 
Alba loves comedy more than life itself, and will die defending her right to make people giggle.

Laughter Class with Alba Woolard
Wednesday, October 7th
7PM - 8PM via Zoom

Zoom information will be sent via email an hour before each lecture.

Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.

title: Advanced Study Improv Studio with Brad McMurran
description:
Advanced Study Improv Studio with Brad McMurran

This course focuses on giving students individual attention to their strengths and weaknesses. We will also break down the different components of improv scenes and the choices that improvisers have and make within those scenes. 

This course will focus primarily on giving the students a deeper understanding of the Harold and providing individual feedback. This class caps at 8 students. Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 501 Wait List".

The safety of our staff and students is our utmost concern.  All classes will be outdoors and will practice social distancing measures. Masks are required. Graduation shows are delayed until further notice.

Improv 501 is a 4 week course on Sunday's at 11:00 am starting October 11th. 
Prerequisites: Improv 401
This course is $170. 

About the instructor:
Brad McMurran is the founder of The Pushers Sketch and Improv Comedy Troupe. He is the co-head writer, performer, and artistic director of the Push Comedy Theater.
Brad studied acting at ODU, trained in improvisation at Upright Citizen's Brigades, and is the co-writer of the off-Broadway hit, Cuff Me; The 50 Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: Laughter Class: The Spirit of Unconditional Performance Support
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.  

The Spirit of Unconditional Performance Support : In my experience, the once simple and welcomed foundation of "Yes And" support of your scene partner eventually becomes a tricky ambiguous bedfellow along the improv journey. As a performer becomes more experienced there are lots of evolutionary positives, such as their confidence grows and their artist's voice expands; with all of this new growth and focus on oneself it's very easy to forget the basic ingredients, including the thing that made improv magic in the first place: Support. We will be discussing: What is the spirit of unconditional support? How to identify where it's lacking? And most importantly, How to correct it? 

About Whittney Millsap:
Whittney Millsap is an actor and improviser from Atlanta, Ga. She’s been an improv company member of Dad's Garage Theatre since 2010. Whittney is a founding member of The Coalition- a female led improv platform that strives to highlight other female, and female identifying, artists. She is one of four powerhouse female improvisers in the group, Sweater Puppies, which has travelled to festivals in the U.S. and Canada. Whittney also performs improvised operas with the group ImprOper. Aside from performance, Whittney teaches improv for Dad’s Garage corporate clients and general public. She has also ventured out to develop and teach an improv program for Senior Citizens at the Central Dekalb Senior Center. It’s a creative dream to be part of the Atlanta community. 

Laughter Class with Whittney Millsap
Wednesday, October 14th
7PM - 8PM via Zoom

Zoom information will be sent via email an hour before each lecture.

Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month. 

Yes, and... any questions? Email us at pusherscomedy@gmail.com

title: WORKSHOP: The Spirit of Unconditional Performance Support
description:
Join Improv Comedian Whittney Millsap October 19th for a hands on Zoom workshop to learn how to create an environment of unconditional support with your scene partners.

Workshop: The Spirit of Unconditional Performance Support : In my experience, the once simple and welcomed foundation of "Yes And" support of your scene partner eventually becomes a tricky ambiguous bedfellow along the improv journey. As a performer becomes more experienced there are lots of evolutionary positives, such as their confidence grows and their artist's voice expands; with all of this new growth and focus on oneself it's very easy to forget the basic ingredients, including the thing that made improv magic in the first place: Support. We will be discussing: What is the spirit of unconditional support? How to identify where it's lacking? And most importantly, How to correct it?

title: Laughter Class: The Nuts and Bolts of Running a Sketch Show
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.

The Nuts and Bolts of Running a Sketch Show
Here's everything you need to know about producing your own sketch comedy show.  From the writing and rehearsal process, to promotion, to dealing with the venue, this lecture will give you some tips and tricks for running your show as smoothly as possible.  Whether you're a fledgling sketch comedian or an established group get the answers to all your burning sketch comedy questions.

About Sean Devereux:
Sean Devereux is the co-owner of The Push Comedy Theater and a founding member of the sketch and improv group, The Pushers.  He has been writing and performing sketch comedy for more than 15 years.  Sean is the co-writer of Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Gray Musical Parody and an Emmy award-winning producer for WVEC-TV13.

Laughter Class with Sean Devereux
Wednesday, October 21st
7PM - 8PM via Zoom
Zoom information will be sent via email an hour before each lecture.

Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.
full_description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.


The Nuts and Bolts of Running a Sketch Show

Here's everything you need to know about producing your own sketch comedy show.  From the writing and rehearsal process, to promotion, to dealing with the venue, this lecture will give you some tips and tricks for running your show as smoothly as possible.  Whether you're a fledgling sketch comedian or an established group get the answers to all your burning sketch comedy questions.


About Sean Devereux:

Sean Devereux is the co-owner of The Push Comedy Theater and a founding member of the sketch and improv group, The Pushers.  He has been writing and performing sketch comedy for more than 15 years.  Sean is the co-writer of Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Gray Musical Parody and an Emmy award-winning producer for WVEC-TV13.


Laughter Class with Sean Devereux

Wednesday, October 21st

7PM - 8PM via Zoom

Zoom information will be sent via email an hour before each lecture.


Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.

title: Laughter Class: Applying The Rules of Improv to Your Daily Life
description:
Laughter Class is a lecture series from the Push Comedy Theater that finds all-star comedians, actors, and performers from across the country to give a one hour lecture on their current passions. Learn the ins and outs of comedy from speakers including Emmy award winners, published writers, voice actors, theater directors, movie and TV stars, seasoned improvisers, sketch comedians, and more.

Applying The Rules of Improv to Your Daily Life
You know how to use the rules of improv on stage but are you applying these rules and techniques in your everyday life? If “all the world’s a stage” why not focus on performing off stage, too? This lecture will explore how you can apply the rules, mantras and methods of improv comedy that are so highly effective on stage and begin to reframe your off-stage life in a more agreeable, collaborative and attentive way. If we can make bold choices, receive gifts, listen and yield on stage why shouldn’t we strive to do the same in our relationships, work-life and self-care?
About Scot Rose
Scot Rose is a Norfolk-based performer, director and improv teacher. Trained at Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA, Scot has directed several pieces for Push Comedy Theater’s “666 Project”, produced, created and directed “Kink with a Wink”, created, produces and performs in “Faces for Radio”, a LIVE! Staged Radio Play with Hilary Stallings, appeared in various full-length theater productions with CORE Theatre Ensemble and will be teaching Improv 201 at Push Comedy Theater in October 2020.

Laughter Class with Scot Rose
Wednesday, October 28th
7PM - 8PM via Zoom
Zoom information will be sent via email an hour before each lecture.

Laughter Class has no prerequisites, no hidden tuition fees, and no mascot (yet). Individual lectures are $10 or subscribe monthly to get one lecture free each month.
